------_=_NextPart_001_01C1978E.7066F3B0
Content-Type: text/plain

Junit is behaving correctly in this case, the rule is: As soon as assertTrue
statement fails the fail is reported and that particular test is aborted.

You will need to use seperate tests if you want to evaluate different
assertTrue statments individualy.

-----Original Message-----
From: vidya_srn [mailto:vidya_srn@...]
Sent: Montag, 07. Janner 2002 16:15
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Unable to accumulate failures within a testcase


Hi
I have just started using Junit 
I have  a test case with multiple asserts .
The testcase run always stops on the first failure.
For ex in the TestCase I am running  if I have,

  assertTrue( "test assert1"  , 1==2);
  assertTrue( "test assert2"  , 1==3);

The run stops after logging the first failure.
How do i accumulate all the failures within the testcase?

Thanks
Vidya
